name: Spritefall Access
effect:
Gain 2 Spritefall Dies, 2d6 starting at 1 each (This is represented as a single 12 sided die, 1d12 starting at 2). Whenever an enemy's HP is reduced to 0 or its heat cap is reached, lower the value of one Spritefall Die by 1, to a minimum of 1 (2 for the 1d12).
When both Spritefall Dies reach 1 (or the 1d12 Spritefall reaches 2), while you are not mounted in your mech, you may reset both to 6 (or 12) and Activate Spritefall as a pilot full action.
The value of your Spritefall Die persists between scenes, but resets when you perform a Full Repair.
description: While the AAF does manufacture and license printing rights to mechs, it is best known for its vast, sprawling satellite array. While not as absolutely destructive as the Long-Spool weapons that are in more common use, the utility of having a weapon that is both powerful and always available is undeniable, and the Spritefall satellite array capitalizes on this demand to the fullest. Capable of punching through the atmosphere without detonating the "round", the Spritefall engages targets with a barrage of fire typically reserved for fleet combat without causing miniature localized catastrophes like many other AAF weapon systems.

actions.name: Activate Spritefall
actions.detail: You activate the Spritefall's firing sequence, firing its weapon at a Blast 3 area within Range 50 and Line of Sight. Until the end of the next round after this action is taken, all characters, objects, and cover that start their turn within the affected area must pass a Hull save or take 4 AP Energy damage for each space they occupy within the affected area and are Slowed until the end of their next turn, and this cannot be reduced in any way. On a success, they take 2 AP Energy Damage and are Slowed until the end of their next turn. Size 1/2 characters that succeed take no damage and are not Slowed.

name: Storm Rifle Priviliges
effect: Gain access to the Storm Rifle Exotic Weapon.
description: The AAF Storm Rifle, once an experimental and legendary tool used by the elite of the elite AAF soldiers, it is now licensed to a very limited and select few lancers who pass an extensive screening process. This is the most common path lancers go through to receive one of these well-renowned weapons, and very few go back on their decision once they've obtained it.

name: Euler Thruster System
effect: You can hover when you Move or Boost; however, you must end the movement on the ground or another solid surface or else immediately begin falling.
description: While the Smith-Shamano All-Theater Movement Suite is a far more popular modification, some pilots prefer the range of motion afforded to them by the Euler Thruster System.

name: Plyboard Structural Conversion
effect: You lose -1 Structure but Gain +9 HP. 1/scene, if you would lose structure and roll on the structure loss table, you may double the result of one dice in the roll. If this would result in a roll result above 6, you are not impaired and simply lose structure.
description: While the Plyboard Structural Conversion is an NHP-guided blueprint refraction technique developed specially to help the Pythagoras Program succeed, the process has been optimized since its inception and the base software is available to appropriately licensed and pilots to reduce the sectional complexity of any mech pattern with a few setting tweaks and a little fiddling with the right option.

synergies.detail: 1/scene, if you would lose structure and roll on the structure loss table, you may double the result of one dice in the roll. If this would result in a roll result above 6, you are not impaired and simply lose structure.

name: Nothung Drone Carrier System
effect: Your mech gains the Nothung Drone Integrated System.
description: The Nothung satellite was a predecessor to the Gram Laser array, a lone satellite hovering over the Atacama for hundreds of years, until the recontact with ThirdComm made its decommission necessary to appease the newly rising Third Committee and its pillars. While the large, massive satellite was later replaced with the Gram Laser array, the Nothung lived on as the name of what was originally a plug-in to the Plyboard Structural Conversion program before it became its own standalone refactoring program which would partition a section of the original blueprint to allow for a parasitic satellite drone to be printed grafted onto the surface of the original frame, where it could then dismount itself and fly using the same reactor-based power generation mechs use. From its high-up vantage point, it can fire a continuous beam laser for miles as a fire support platform.

name: Donation to the AAF
effect: Gain one reserve of your choice with the GM's permission. This reserve is permanent; instead of expiring at the end of a mission, the reserve is refreshed at the end of the mission or at GMâ€™s discretion.
description: Some pilots opt to simply give their time to the AAF in leu of any special permissions, hidden techniques, or unique software licensing rights. While the AAF appreciates their dedication, it refuses to have it go unrewarded and has instead opted to offer a "Donator's Bonus".

name: Shredder Missile License
effect: Upon taking this core bonus, you are immediately licensed to use the Shredder Missile Strike. 1/mission, you may use the Request Shredder Missile Strike full action.
description:
"Side effects include shell shock, mutation, and/or death." - Armory Description
Designed to cause miniature localized catastrophes and leave a lasting impact, the Shredder Micro-Nuclear Tactical missile is licensed to a select few who have proven themselves to be true heroes of democracy. Despite this, a Helldiver's ability to cause accidental death with one should never be underestimated.

actions.name: Request Shredder Missile Strike
actions.detail: 1/mission, while you are outside your mech, you may choose a Blast 4 area centered at a point within Range 5. All characters know where this area is, and on the end of the next round, the Shredder Missile lands there, dealing 3d6+15 AP Explosive damage to anything caught in the blast.

name: Helldiver Humunculi Program
effect:
Your mech gains the AI tag, though this does not count against the number of AIs you may have on your mech. While under the control of this AI, the mech may not benefit from your talents but, as it is not an NHP, this AI will not cascade. At the start of each mission, choose 1 NPC role (Ex. Striker, Artillery, etc.) Against your chosen Role, you gain the following benefits:
  • You a roll a critical on attack rolls higher than 19. If another rule already causes this, it extends to 18, then 17, going on as such.
  • You gain +1 accuracy on attacks.
  • 1/round, you may choose to deal +1d6 bonus Kinetic damage when you hit with a ranged or melee attack.
description: The Helldivers training program not only extends to their personnel; their computers are also presented with humunculi trained on combat data gathered by the user to best combat relevant threats found on the field.

name: Cardio Accelerator
effect: 1/scene, you gain may Boost as a free action.
description: Incorrectly called MASC (Myomer Accelerator Signal Circuitry) by some, the Cardio Accelerator is a advanced technological advancement that overcharges the actuators in your mech, allowing for increased dynamic performance.

synergies.detail: 1/scene, you may Boost as a free action.

name: Bastion Up-Armour Program
effect: You gain 1 Armour and 2 evasion, but lose 1 Speed.
description: By welding some frontal armour plates from TD-110 Bastion tank destroyers to their mechs, some pilots like to increase the protection they offer. This usually comes at the cost of extra weight, but most will argue the pros outweigh the cons.

name: Democracy Protects
effect: 1/scene, If an attack would cause you to lose structure, before the hit roll is made, you may immediately roll a d6: on 4+, the attack misses; on 3-, gain resistance to that attack and, if you take structure damage, immediately move up to your speed, ignoring all statuses, conditions, and engagement. This does not stack with but is used instead of invisible.
description: Belief in the Union Pillars and the freedom of all is believed to be a self-reinforcing force of many Helldiver Licensees.

name: Cape Priviliges
effect: You are invisible during your turn, attacks against you during your turn receive +1 difficulty, and you may move up to your speed then drop prone as a quick action to clear burn.

actions.name: Safety Dive
actions.detail: Move a number of spaces up to your speed, drop prone, then clear any burn on your mech.

description: Even Exosuits wear capes! Capes provide a level of dashing flair that guarantees the safety of the pilot - when they're paying attention.
